2.68.text:
Marie:                     Hey
it's Marie Forleo and you are watching MarieTV,

8.11.text:
the place to be to create a business and life
you love, and today, I have got a question

14.04.text:
for you. Does goal setting burn you out? Do
you ever feel like you're on achievement autopilot

20.17.text:
constantly striving for more and never feeling
fulfilled? Even if you love goal setting,

26.82.text:
you're about to learn a revolutionary new
way to set and reach those goals. No stress,

32.35.text:
striving or affirmations required. My guest
is about to show you how.

40.46.text:
Danielle LaPorte is the creator of The Desire
Map, a guide to creating goals with soul;

45.47.text:
author of the Firestarter Sessions and soon
to be publisher of Danielle Magazine launching

50.73.text:
this spring. An inspirational speaker, former
Think Tank exec and business strategist, her

56.44.text:
site daniellelaporte.com has been deemed the
best place online for kickass spirituality

63.51.text:
and was named one of the top 100 websites
for women by Forbes.

70.23.text:
Danielle! This is your second time on MarieTV,
the first time live because we did all kinds

77.78.text:
Danielle:     I got on a plane just for
you.

79.67.text:
Marie:                     I
love you for that. I know you're going to

82.50.text:
take us through this incredible process and
I am so excited about it, and I have to say

86.35.text:
here right now, we're going to talk a lot
about The Desire Map. If you do not have this

91.00.text:
book, you need to get your hands on it ASAP.
We're going to teach you a lot, but it goes

94.95.text:
so deep. Just trust me on that one.
Before we get into the all the nitty-gritty,

99.96.text:
I want to know from you what made you write
The Desire Map? How did it come about? Why

107.19.text:
Danielle:     I wanted to feel good and
I wanted to feel better about what I was going

114.54.text:
after and the way I was going after it. All
this started on New Years Eve writing some

121.67.text:
goals out, watching Ryan Seacrest by the fire.
It's like "pay off MasterCard, lose the

128.62.text:
baby weight, get to Hawaii," all that, and
I looked at my goals completely uninspired

134.11.text:
and I thought how do I really want to feel,
and then it was like "sexy, affluence, abundant,

137.69.text:
earth" all of that, and I could breathe.
In that whole process, I looked at how I related

150.11.text:
Set a goal, go after the goal fiercely because
I'm an ambitious cat and not hit the goal.

157.73.text:
Not only not hit the goal, totally bomb so
I feel like a loser. Set a goal, go after

162.84.text:
the goal, reach the goal but I'm three months
late or six months late or three years late.

169.19.text:
I got there but I still feel like a loser
because I'm late to my goal. Set a goal, go

173.46.text:
after a goal, something shinier, and something
truly better over here, mid course correction,

180.90.text:
I'm going that way. I still feel like a loser
because I changed my mind. Set a goal, go

187.23.text:
after the goal, not just reach the goal, exceed
the goal, out of the park like super success

194.41.text:
and I think I still feel like a loser because
I should've thought bigger because I was

198.40.text:
thinking so small and I should've asked
for more. Contentious relationship around

203.39.text:
goals and not loving who I was in that striving.
That striving for the goal really brought

215.28.text:
out what I call Connie; she's my alter ego
and I like Jersey but she's a Jersey girl

222.39.text: and Connie is really fucking pushy.

228.71.text:
My inner Jersey girl had to talk to a Buddhist
about this and I had a conversation with a

234.93.text:
llama and I said "I'm interested in this
tension between just accepting what is and

244.88.text:
presence, and the striving and attaining and
going after stuff. Where is that middle ground?"

252.89.text:
He said, "You're always going to have desires.
There's always going to be a reaching. You

259.17.text:
just have to ask yourself if you're being
pushy about it." I was like pushy and I'm

270.89.text:
Marie:                     You
had that idea come into you and it was like

276.51.text:
"pushing, don't want to do that." Was
it immediate link up to this concept of desires

284.89.text:
Danielle:     Light bulb, I want to feel
good, I want to feel better than I feel. Light

292.06.text:
bulb, it's not about the goal. I am wanting
to feel a certain way when I get there. It's

300.58.text:
not about the goal; it's about how you want
to feel when you get there. I made a little

304.77.text:
post-it note, put it in my Day Timer, and
this is eight years in the making, and I would

313.51.text:
ask myself "what am I going to do today
to feel this way." Then I started asking

318.46.text:
myself "what am I going to do this quarter
to feel this way," and was like "what

322.75.text:
do my yearly goals need to look like to feel
the way that I want to feel?" It changed

329.90.text:
what I went after, it changed how I went after
it, and I felt more the way I wanted to feel.

337.83.text:
Marie:                     That's
so beautiful and I love one of the things

340.67.text:
that you share in The Desire Map and all throughout
your work. It's like we have goal setting

345.56.text:
and achievement backwards. We have it inside
out because if you break any goal down and

351.58.text:
you go "why do I want this, what am I really
going after," I think it's so genius and

356.22.text:
so simple and so profound and how you articulated
it is beautiful. It really is about the feeling

361.38.text:
and that desire. And so, you've taken in
the personal development world, goal setting

366.71.text:
has been talked about a zillion times and
put it inside out and I mean, people love

372.19.text: this stuff. I love it; I just think its genius.

375.86.text:
The Desire Map and the core concept of this
is really, what?

379.95.text:
Danielle:     It's about what I call
your core-desired feelings. I'm going to give

386.78.text:
you the steps; we're going to do the reveal
now. Step one of this is let's concentrate

393.52.text:
on just three areas. In The Desire Map process,
there's about five or six areas to look at

399.26.text:
in life, but it you're at home doing this
and grab a pen, you can write this down, you

403.01.text:
can do this in meditation or do this on a
walk. Go through lifestyle and livelihood,

410.53.text:
go through body and wellness and go through
what I call relationships and society, and

418.17.text:
do a stream of consciousness about how you
want to feel. Just rift and don't hold back.

424.10.text:
If you want to feel vitality, if you want
to feel energized, if you want to feel connected,

427.99.text:
so many people just want to feel connected,
if you want to feel spicy, just write spicy

432.17.text: down. Write down "blue," I want it.

437.76.text:
With that no holding back, then you do need
to move into that phase of this second step

443.40.text:
which is about eliminating what you're not
resonating with. It's really about pattern

449.43.text:
recognition. You go through that mish mash,
that outpouring of feelings and then the intention

455.41.text:
is to get that down to three, four, maybe
five and this is an art; this is not a science.

462.49.text:
If your lucky number is seven and you want
have seven core desired feelings, you can

466.22.text:
have seven core desired feelings. You're going
to narrow it down and what I encourage people

472.60.text:
to do in that honing end phase is to stay
away from the big audacious words like confidence

483.89.text:
Danielle:     Because it's an epidemic
that we have bought into other people's

488.48.text:
version and visions of success, and this is
one of the reasons that we are disconnected

493.64.text:
from our core desired feelings. We are living
other people's dreams, we are doing what

499.21.text:
we think the Jones' are doing, and guess
what? They're not even feeling success. It's

503.82.text:
like the ultimate tragedy for tracing chasing
other versions of success and they're not

507.20.text:
even feeling successful. This goes on lifetimes
for people. This is a big, big deal.

517.62.text:
Success has a feeling underneath. You might
say, "Success is about respect." Go deeper;

527.04.text:
what is respect about? Respect is about confidence.
Go underneath that. Look up the definitions

532.12.text:
of the word; find out the ontology of the
word. What's under confidence? Love. One of

540.80.text: your core desired feelings is love.

543.19.text:
And then there's one more refinement I would
add to this, which is getting clear on your

548.10.text:
core desired feelings is not about you setting
up the world to help you feel the way that

555.54.text:
Marie:                     I
love this. Keep telling me.

558.54.text:
Danielle:     This isn't about "I want
to feel loved." Of course, you want to feel

562.47.text:
loved; we all want to feel loved. This is
universal. This isn't about "I want to

565.96.text:
feel honored, I want to feel respected."
You may need to live with those core desired

571.38.text:
feelings for a while and try them on, but
this is not about going into the office on

576.98.text:
Monday morning and thinking "I know my core
desired feelings and I want to feel respected

582.17.text:
from this crew." You are relying on outside
forces to inform your reality; this is not

590.23.text:
good. Knowing your core desired feelings is
really about you becoming an intentional creator

597.45.text:
of your life. You cannot choose what happens
to you, but you can choose how you feel about

607.00.text:
Let's say respect is you're playing with
this as a core desired feeling. Just let it

613.17.text:
be respect or respectful, not respected. You
can even feel the difference of the energy

620.99.text:
in those words and you will put respect out
into the world, you will put beauty out, you

627.42.text:
Marie:                     I
love that and I feel like it's such an opportunity

631.48.text:
for all of us to create our own game for ourselves
of what has to happen in order for me to experience

639.58.text:
respect, honoring that it is not about how
the outside world treats us, but how am I

646.79.text:
approaching the outside world. How can I bring
respect to the party, so to speak, or love

652.63.text:
or anything like that. That makes me so excited
because one of the things I talked about a

657.61.text:
lot and people always ask me about passion,
how can I find my passion? You've heard

662.14.text:
me say this a million times because you and
I are such good friends, but it's like passion

664.94.text:
isn't something outside of you; passion
is something you bring to the moment. You

670.06.text:
bring that to the task, you bring that to
work and it's this muscle you build it.

674.09.text:
I love to hear you say this because I can
hear those voices going "people aren't

678.83.text:
respecting me or people aren't loving me."
How can you set up the rules for yourself

684.33.text:
that anytime perhaps I take a moment to pause
and really notice the beauty of my life, I

692.37.text:
get to experience respect from myself and
what I create, or anytime I take a moment

697.57.text:
and really notice my surroundings and really
appreciate it, I get to experience love in

702.66.text:
the world where it's like you setup your
own rules.

705.13.text:
Danielle:     This is where the rubber
meets the road. This is about getting up every

711.16.text:
day and saying, "What am I going to do today
to generate these core desired feelings?"

716.41.text:
It's as simple as "I'm going to make that
phone call, I'm going to wear a skirt instead

723.11.text:
of yoga pants, I'm going to make sure I get
to yoga today, I'm going to sign the contract."

729.62.text:
Sometimes being devoted to being this truly
creative force in your life means you're going

736.09.text:
to make dramatic changes according to your
core desired feelings. You are going to sell

740.33.text:
your house and go to India or you're going
to get out of Indiana and move to New York

745.70.text:
or you're going to dump the chump or you're
going to commit. It's micro and it's macro.

755.03.text:
My version of spirituality has got to be practical.
This has got to work in my kitchen, this has

760.83.text:
got to work in my bedroom and it's got to
work in my heart.

764.05.text:
Marie:                     Amen
to that. What's step three?

768.18.text:
Danielle:     Step three is the declaration
of your core-desired feelings. This is it.

773.43.text:
This is my three to seven core desired feelings
and hopefully it feels like a big righteous

779.89.text:
moment and you can experiment with this. Some
people do The Desire Map in a weekend and

786.25.text:
for some people its months to get clear on
their core desired feelings. I worked with

790.23.text:
my core-desired feelings five years. Five
years I had that same little ratty post-it

795.97.text: note sitting in my Day Timer.

798.57.text:
Step four is really where you're going to
match your soul with your goals, so you're

803.21.text:
going to go through those lifestyle areas
that we've already listed. Livelihood and

809.00.text:
lifestyle, and body and wellness, relationships
in society, and then ask yourself what do

814.99.text:
you need to do and have an experience and
the stuff you want to get and be in the world

821.37.text:
to feel your core desired feelings. You should
have your core desired feelings right here,

827.29.text:
you're having your experiences and you go
"I need to climb a mountain this year, I

832.35.text:
need to launch my business, I need to propose,"
to feel this way, "I need to sign up for

838.93.text:
belly dancing lessons, I need to read the
books I've wanted to read," whatever it

843.22.text:
is that's pulling at you. Narrow that down
to your one, two, maybe three goals of the

852.62.text: year and there you have it.

854.98.text:
There are lots of layers. You're going to
go deep into asking yourself what's really

859.66.text:
going to make the final cut for you, but this
is precisely where so many of us go into default

866.87.text:
and go astray. As soon as we get into that
mentality of I'm setting my goals, our psyche

875.30.text:
immediately heads externally. "I better
make my million, I better get that gig, etc."

881.73.text:
You have to come back to center, how do I
want to feel? The goal, the intention is to

890.77.text:
Marie:                     So
good. It's really good. I think it's revolutionary.

896.08.text:
I remember when you first shared with me The
Desire Map and this whole core concept, I

900.82.text:
had the feeling inside and I literally got
chills and I was like Danielle, this is the

904.69.text:
core of your work and of your message and
I just think it's so beautiful. I know there

909.62.text:
are tens of thousands, hundreds of thousands
Danielle fans out there and for those who

914.63.text:
don't know, I'm curious what your core desired
feelings are.

918.50.text:
Danielle:     My core desired feelings
are joy; it took me a long time to get to

924.36.text:
that. I used to think being not fully happy
was sexier or something and I was like people

932.89.text:
who are a little bit depressive. It's like
happy people are so annoying; now I'm just

938.90.text:
like joy, true nature joy. Divine femininity,
that shakti of just goddess,yes, woman. Creation;

947.51.text:
for a long time the word was creativity for
me, but I want to feel creation and I want

955.97.text:
to make creation. Abundance. Those are my
core desired feelings and they guide the restaurants

967.94.text:
I eat at and how I parent and how I love and
what I say yes to.

974.79.text:
Marie:                     I
just got chills listening and I've seen you

980.41.text:
evolve and I've seen how you've brought
those core-desired feelings to life. One of

985.28.text:
my jobs, and I think one of my gifts, is I
always tend to hear intuitively what other

989.64.text:
people are saying and tap into that, and I
can almost hear people in our audience saying

993.99.text:
all this is well and good, these feelings
are great, but what happens when everything

999.91.text:
sucks and you don't feel the way that you'd
like to feel? You don't feel your core desired

1005.54.text:
feelings and however temporary it may seem,
the world is coming in on you and you don't

1010.98.text: know how to get out. What do you say to that?

1013.34.text:
Danielle:     I say two things. One, that's
life. That's how you make progress. I feel

1018.50.text:
the way I want to feel, I go this way and
I don't feel the way I want to feel. You

1021.22.text:
learn through contrast. This isn't about
"I feel the way I want to feeling all the

1026.25.text:
time"; this is life. This is wholeness.
The best thing about being clear about your

1032.89.text:
core desired feelings is when you're in those
moments of hell really, like I'm angry, I

1039.44.text:
don't want to be in the agony of anger.
You don't want to be in the agony of restriction

1044.26.text:
or insecurity, but when you're in those places,
the very simple act of stop, this is not how

1051.81.text:
I want to feel, you've already stopped the
monkey mind because what happens when you're

1056.93.text:
in the agonizing feelings is you go "I should
be doing this, they should be doing that,

1062.55.text:
this is family of origin stuff, this is my
mother issues coming up again, I better get

1066.98.text:
to yoga, I better move my therapy appointment."
All those things may be true but they're not

1072.14.text:
actually helping; they're just keeping the
monkey mind amped up. "This is not how I

1076.69.text:
want to feel." Stop. What I really want
to feel is... and set your core desired feelings.

1084.91.text:
You just interrupted that chatter that brings
you south and you have just stepped into possibility

1092.47.text:
thinking. My belief is that when you declare
your desires to yourself specifically, your

1099.71.text:
desired feelings, something happens; your
brain starting firing in a different way.

1106.52.text:
There's an expansion that happens so you can
see different options. Solutions will come

1111.41.text:
to you, "I could apologize, and I could
slam the door."

1115.62.text:
Marie:                     If
you're feeling angry and one of your core-desired

1118.96.text:
feelings is love, a question you may ask yourself
could be "what do I need to do right now

1124.44.text:
to feel love? What can I take control over
to actually experience love in this moment?"

1130.49.text:
It's almost like we keep taking the power
back for ourselves and stop being such a ping

1137.35.text: pong ball to the rest of the world.

1140.04.text:
Danielle:     Some of my most important
decisions have come from those moments where

1145.55.text:
I go "this is not how I want to feel,"
and that was really the hinge of my relationship

1154.34.text:
with goal setting. I'm sitting at my computer,
it's 12:30 am, I got a cold pot of tea on

1161.82.text:
my desk because I haven't moved my ass in
hours and I'm hustling in a way that I don't

1167.00.text:
want to hustle because I said I was going
to reach that goal no matter what. "No matter

1170.97.text:
what" is a very dangerous phrase when it
comes to your wholeness and I just thought

1178.44.text:
this is not how I want to feel. Et voila,
core desired feelings. Mo better.

1184.30.text:
Marie:                     As
we wrap up, I would love to hear your take

1188.51.text:
about the power of believing that we deserve
what we're going after.

1193.08.text:
Danielle:     Essential, critical; it has
to happen. You can have your goals with soul

1200.66.text:
and you put those out to life, to your mastermind
group, to whoever's supporting you, and

1206.45.text:
if internally you're thinking "But I'm too
small for the bigness of this, what have I

1213.44.text:
don't to earn this, I don't have the cred
for this," then you're really sending mixed

1218.68.text:
signals to your mastermind group and the angelic
grew and whoever is on your side. You have

1227.95.text:
to really do whatever you need to do. The
sacred homework is that opening, that allowing

1236.71.text:
into worthiness and if you can't feel it yourself
because we've all been there and we will hit

1245.71.text:
that in different levels again and again,
then really this is the sacred time to turn

1252.63.text:
outside of yourself and look for affirmation
and support that you are worth it.

1258.30.text:
I'll just tell you now, you are worth it,
you are important and you are worthy of your

1267.46.text:
Marie:                     Which
is a beautiful place to wrap. Danielle, you

1272.07.text:
are a magical, incredible being. I am so honored
to call you my friend and I am so thankful

1277.19.text:
and grateful that you came here today to share
this beautiful work with us. Thank you so

1281.51.text: much for being on MarieTV. I love you.

1284.90.text:
Marie:                     Now
Danielle and I would love to hear from you.

1290.16.text:
Number one, what was the single biggest insight
that you're taking away from this interview?

1295.59.text:
Number two, which I would love to hear about,
what's just one of your core desired feelings?

1302.42.text:
Tell us all about it in the comments below.
As always, the best discussions happen after

1307.71.text:
the episode over at marieforleo.com so go
there and leave a comment now.

1313.12.text:
Did you like this video? I certainly did.
If you did, subscribe and share it with your

1317.76.text:
friends. If you want even more great resources
to create a business and life you love, plus

1322.54.text:
some personal insights from me that I only
talk about in email, get those sweet buns

1326.36.text:
over to marieforleo.com and sign up for e-mail
updates.

1330.24.text:
Stay on your game and keep going for your
dreams because the world really needs that

1335.38.text:
special gift that only you have. Thank you
so much for watching and I'll catch you
